cover.text: Questions are an accurate representation of actual exam content
Pass this and you will pass the exam no problemo

question.text: Which three tasks can be performed using SQL functions built into Oracle Database?

choices.label: A
choices.text: Displaying a date in nondefault format

choices.label: B
choices.text: Finding the number of characters in an expression

choices.label: C
choices.text: Substituting a character string in a text expression with a specified string

choices.label: D
choices.text: Combining more than two columns or expressions into a single column in the output

choices.label: A

1. One-to-One    a) Teacher to Student
2. One-to-Many   b) Employess to Manager
3. Many-to-One   c) Person to SSN
4. Many-to-Many  d) Customers to Products
Which option indicates the correctly matched relationships?

question.text: Which two statements are true regarding constraints?

choices.label: A
choices.text: A column with the unique constraint can contain null values.

choices.label: B
choices.text: All constraints can be defined at the column level as well as the table level.

choices.label: C
choices.text: A constraint can be disabled even if the constraint column contains data.

choices.label: D
choices.text: A foreign key cannot contain null values.

choices.label: E
choices.text: A constraint is enforced only for the insert operation on a table.

https://s3.amazonaws.com/electron-exam/oracle-1z0-061/16a.PNG
Which statement is true regarding the outcome of the above query?

choices.label: B
choices.text: It displays only the values A%_WQ123 and AB_WQ123

choices.label: D
choices.text: It displays only the values A%_WQ123 and A%BWQ123

choices.label: E
choices.text: It displays only the values A%BWQ123 and AB_WQ123

Examine the structure of the EMPLOYEES table:
https://s3.amazonaws.com/electron-exam/oracle-1z0-061/19a.PNG
Which INSERT statement is valid?

choices.label: A
choices.text: INSERT INTO employees(employee_id, first_name, last_name, Hire_date) VALUES ( 1000, ‘John’, ‘Smith’, To_date(‘01/01/01’));

choices.label: B
choices.text: INSERT INTO employees(employee_id, first_name, last_name, hire_date) VALUES ( 1000, ‘John’, ‘Smith’, ’01-Jan-01′);

choices.label: C
choices.text: INSERT INTO employees(employee_id, first_name, last_name, hire_date) VALUES ( 1000, ‘John’, ‘Smith’, ’01 January 01′);

choices.label: D
choices.text: INSERT INTO employees (employee_id, first_name, last_name, hire_date) VALUES ( 1000, ‘John’, ‘Smith’, ‘01/01/01’);

question.text: Which two statements are true regarding the ORDER BY clause?
(Choose Two)

choices.label: A
choices.text: You cannot specify a column name followed by an expression in this clause.

choices.label: B
choices.text: It must be the last clause in the SELECT statement.

choices.label: C
choices.text: It is executed first in the query execution.

choices.label: D
choices.text: It cannot be used in a SELECT statement containing a HAVING clause.

choices.label: E
choices.text: You can specify a combination of numeric positions and column names in this clause.

You need to create a table with the following column specifications:
1. Employee ID (numeric data type) for each employee
2. Employee Name (character data type) that stores the employee name
3. Hire date, which stores the date of joining the organization for each employee
4. Status (character data type), that contains the value 'active' if no data is entered
5. Resume (character large object [CLOB] data type), which contains the resume submitted by the employee
Which is the correct syntax to create this table?
https://s3.amazonaws.com/electron-exam/oracle-1z0-061/23a.PNG
Which arithmetic operations can be performed on a column by using a SQL function that is built into Oracle database?
(Choose Three)
You work as a database administrator at ABC.com. You study the CUSTOMER table carefully.
https://s3.amazonaws.com/electron-exam/oracle-1z0-061/25a.PNG
Evaluate the following query.
https://s3.amazonaws.com/electron-exam/oracle-1z0-061/25b.PNG
The above query produces an error on execution. What is the reason for the error?

choices.label: A
choices.text: The alias MIDPOINT should be enclosed within double quotation marks for the CUST_CREDIT_LIMIT/2  expression

choices.label: B
choices.text: The MIDPOINT +100 expression gives an error because CUST_CREDIT_LIMIT contains NULL values

choices.label: C
choices.text: The alias NAME should not be enclosed within double quotation marks

choices.label: D
choices.text: An alias cannot be used in an expression

choices.label: A

question.text: Examine the description of the EMP_DETAILS table given below:
https://s3.amazonaws.com/electron-exam/oracle-1z0-061/30a.PNG
Which two statements are true regarding SQL statements that can be executed on the EMP_DETAIL table?
(Choose Two)

choices.label: A
choices.text: You can alter the table to include the NOT NULL constraint on the EMP_IMAGE column

choices.label: B
choices.text: An EMP_IMAGE column cannot be included in the ORDER BY clause

choices.label: C
choices.text: An EMP_IMAGE column can be included in the GROUP BY clause

choices.label: D

question.text: What are the distinguishing characteristics of a public synonym rather than a private synonym?
(Choose Two)

choices.label: A
choices.text: Public synonyms can be accessed by name without a schema qualifier.

choices.label: B
choices.text: Public synonyms can be selected from without needing any permissions.

choices.label: C
choices.text: Public synonyms can have the same names as tables or views.

choices.label: D
choices.text: Public synonyms are always visible to all users.

When a COMMIT is issued, what will happen?

choices.label: A
choices.text: All the change vectors that make up the transaction are written to disk

choices.label: B
choices.text: DBWn writes the change blocks to disk

choices.label: C
choices.text: LGWR writes the log buffer to disk

choices.label: D
choices.text: The undo data is deleted so that the changes can no longer be rolled back

question.text: Which four are attributes of single row functions?
(Choose Four)

choices.label: A
choices.text: Accept arguments which can be a column or an expression

choices.label: C
choices.text: Accept only one value and return only one value

question.text: You issued the following command:
SQL> DROP TABLE employees;
Which three statements are true?

choices.label: B
choices.text: All indexes and constraints defined on the table being dropped are also dropped

choices.label: C
choices.text: Sequences used in the employees table become invalid

choices.label: D
choices.text: The space used by the employees table is reclaimed immediately

choices.label: E
choices.text: The employees table can be recovered using the rollback command

choices.label: F
choices.text: The employees table is moved to the recycle bin

question.text: Examine the create table statements for the stores and sales tables.
SQL> CREATE TABLE stores(store_id NUMBER(4) CONSTRAINT store_id_pk PRIMARY KEY, store_name VARCHAR2(12), store_address VARCHAR2(20), start_date DATE);

SQL> CREATE TABLE sales(sales_id NUMBER(4) CONSTRAINT sales_id_pk PRIMARY KEY, item_id NUMBER(4), quantity NUMBER(10), sales_date DATE, store_id NUMBER(4), CONSTRAINT store_id_fk FOREIGN KEY(store_id) REFERENCES stores(store_id));
You executed the following statement:
SQL> DELETE from stores WHERE store_id=900;
The statement fails due to the integrity constraint error:
ORA-02292: integrity constraint (HR.STORE_ID_FK) violated
Which three options ensure that the statement will execute successfully?

choices.label: A
choices.text: Disable the PRIMARY KEY in STORES table

choices.label: B
choices.text: Use CASCADE keyword with DELETE statement

choices.label: C
choices.text: DELETE the rows with STORE_ID = 900 from the SALES table and then DELETE rows from STORES table

choices.label: D
choices.text: Disable the FOREIGN KEY in SALES table and then DELETE rows

choices.label: E
choices.text: Create the FOREIGN KEY in the SALES table on SALES_ID column with ON DELETE CASCADE option

question.text: You want to create a sales table with the following column specifications and data types:
SALESID: Number
STOREID: Number
ITEMID: Number
QTY: Number, should be set to 1 when no value is specified
SLSDATE: Date, should be set to current date when no value is specified
PAYMENT: Characters up to 30 characters, should be set to CASH when no value is specified
Which statement would create the table?
https://s3.amazonaws.com/electron-exam/oracle-1z0-061/40a.PNG
Review the following two SQL statements, and choose the appropriate option.
https://s3.amazonaws.com/electron-exam/oracle-1z0-061/41a.PNG

choices.label: A
choices.text: Statement 1 will succeed, and statement 2 will fail

choices.label: C
choices.text: Statement 2 will succeed, and statement 1 will fail

choices.label: D
choices.text: Statement 1 and statement 2 will produce the same results

question.text: The following query retrieves the LAST_NAME, SALARY, and COMMISSION_PCT values for employees whose LAST_NAME begins with the letter “R”.

Based on the following query, choose the ORDER BY clause that first sorts the results by the COMMISSION_PCT column, listing highest commission earners first, and then sorts the results in ascending order by the SALARY column.
Any records with NULL COMMISSION_PCT must appear last.
https://s3.amazonaws.com/electron-exam/oracle-1z0-061/42a.PNG

choices.label: A
choices.text: ORDER BY 3 DESC, 2 ASC NULLS LAST;

choices.label: B
choices.text: ORDER BY COMMISSION_PCT DESC, SALARY ASC;

choices.label: C
choices.text: ORDER BY 3 DESC NULLS LAST, 2 ASC;

question.text: See the Exhibit and examine the structure of ORD table:
https://s3.amazonaws.com/electron-exam/oracle-1z0-061/43a.PNG
What would be the outcome of the above statements?

choices.label: A
choices.text: All the statements would execute successfully and the ORD_NO column would contain the value 2 for the  CUST_ID 101.

choices.label: B
choices.text: All the statements would execute successfully and the ORD_NO column would have the value 20 for the  CUST_ID 101 because the default CACHE value is 20.

choices.label: C
choices.text: The CREATE SEQUENCE command would not execute because the minimum value and maximum value  for the sequence have not been specified.

choices.label: D
choices.text: The CREATE SEQUENCE command would not execute because the starting value of the sequence and  the increment value have not been specified.

question.text: Which two are true about aggregate functions?
(Choose Two)

choices.label: A
choices.text: You can mix single row columns with aggregate functions in the column list of a SELECT statement by  grouping on the single row columns.

choices.label: B
choices.text: You can use aggregate functions on a table, only by grouping the whole table as one single group.

choices.label: C
choices.text: You cannot group the rows of a table by more than one column while using aggregate functions.

choices.label: D
choices.text: You can pass column names, expressions, constants, or functions as parameter to an aggregate function.

choices.label: E
choices.text: You can use aggregate functions in any clause of a SELECT statement.

choices.label: F
choices.text: You can use aggregate functions only in the column list of the select clause and in the WHERE clause of a  SELECT statement.

question.text: What value is returned after executing the following statement?
SELECT NVL2(NULLIF('CODA','SID'),'SPANIEL','TERRIER') FROM DUAL;
Which two statements are true regarding views?
(Choose Two)

choices.label: A
choices.text: Rows added through a view are deleted from the table automatically when the view is dropped.

choices.label: B
choices.text: Rows cannot be deleted through a view if the view definition contains the DISTINCT keyword.

choices.label: C
choices.text: A simple view in which column aliases have been used cannot be updated.

choices.label: D
choices.text: The OR REPLACE option is used to change the definition of an existing view without dropping and  recreating it.

choices.label: E
choices.text: The WITH CHECK OPTION constraint can be used in a view definition to restrict the columns displayed through the view.

question.text: Look at the diagram. What kind of relationship exists between MOVIES and CHARACTERS?
https://s3.amazonaws.com/electron-exam/oracle-1z0-061/47a.PNG

choices.label: A
choices.text: One movie can have only one character.

choices.label: B
choices.text: Many movies may have many characters.

choices.label: C
choices.text: Each movie must have one or more characters.

choices.label: D
choices.text: Each movie may have one or more characters.

question.text: View the Exhibit and examine the structure of the PRODUCTS table.
https://s3.amazonaws.com/electron-exam/oracle-1z0-061/48a.PNG
Which two tasks would require subqueries?
(Choose Two)

choices.label: A
choices.text: Display all suppliers whose list price is less than 1000.

choices.label: B
choices.text: Display the number of products whose list price is more than the average list price.

choices.label: C
choices.text: Display the minimum list price for each product status.

choices.label: D
choices.text: Display all products whose minimum list price is more than the average list price of products and have the status ‘orderable’.

choices.label: E
choices.text: Display the total number of products supplied by supplier 102 and have product status as ‘obsolete’.

question.text: A SELECT statement can be used to perform these three functions:
1. Choose rows from a table.
2. Choose columns from a table
3. Bring together data that is stored in different tables by creating a link between them.
Which set of keywords describes these capabilities?
Examine the data in the PROMO_BEGIN_DATE column of the promotions table:
https://s3.amazonaws.com/electron-exam/oracle-1z0-061/50a.PNG
You want to display the number of promotions started in 1999 and 2000. Which query gives the correct output?
https://s3.amazonaws.com/electron-exam/oracle-1z0-061/50b.PNG
Consider the following queries:
https://s3.amazonaws.com/electron-exam/oracle-1z0-061/51a.PNG
Which of the following assertions best describes the results?

choices.label: A
choices.text: Queries 1 and 2 are valid SQL; queries 3 and 4 are not valid.

choices.label: B
choices.text: Queries 1 and 3 produce identical results; queries 2 and 4 will produce errors.

choices.label: C
choices.text: Queries 1 and 2 produce identical results, and queries 3 and 4 produce identical results, but queries 1 and 3 produce different results.

choices.label: F
choices.text: Queries 1, 2, and 3 produce identical results; query 4 will produce errors.
